**** Etymology[edit] ****
Tedesco derives the word from a dissimilating Prakritization of an unattested
compound *рдиреГрдЧрд░ (*nс╣Ыgar├б, тАЬgathering of menтАЭ), from рдиреГ (nс╣Ы) +тАО *рдЧрд░ (gara). It is
likely the ultimate source of similar words in Dravidian; compare Old_Tamil
ЁСАжЁСАУЁСАнЁСБЖ (nakar, тАЬhouse, palace, temple, cityтАЭ), Telugu р░ир░Чр░░р▒Б (nagaru, тАЬpalaceтАЭ).
Southworth derives the word from Proto-South Dravidian *nakar.
